sentences: Daniel Bernard Bank (July 17, 1922 – June 5, 2010) was an American jazz saxophonist, clarinetist, and flautist.
He was born on July 17, 1922.
Early in his career Bank played with Charlie Barnet (1942–1944), and would return to play with him repeatedly over the next few decades.
He played with Benny Goodman, Tommy and Jimmy Dorsey, Artie Shaw and Paul Whiteman in the 1940s.
He played with Davis on his 1961 Carnegie Hall concert.
Later in the 1960s he recorded with the big bands of Charles Mingus, Sonny Rollins, and Stanley Turrentine.
